tit.cmt: 人名を修正しました。補足情報は削除し、後項に移動しました。

sen.j: 智鳳（ちほう、生没年不詳）は、奈良時代における新羅の僧。
sen.e: Ho CHI (DOB unknown) was a priest in the ancient Korean Shilla priest during Japan`s Nara period.
Chiho (aka Jibong in Korean; years of birth and death unknown) was a priest from ancient Korean Shilla, who lived in the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 用語・形式・表現を修正しました
sen.e: Chiho (aka Jibong in Korean; years of birth and death unknown) was a priest from ancient Korean Shilla, who lived in the Nara period.

sen.j: 703年（大宝 (日本)3年）智鸞・智雄などとともに入唐し、慈恩大師基（或いは窺基）の法孫で法相第3祖の濮陽（ぼくよう）大師智周に師事して法相宗を学んだ。
sen.e: In 703 visited China together with Yu CHI and Ran CHI (Korean name `Jiran`) studied the Hosso sect Tripitaka under high-priest (or possibly a priest named Kuiji) and became a pupil of high-priest Shu CHI at Puyang in China.

In 703, he visited Tang China together with Chiran and Chiyu, studied Faxiang Buddhism (or Dharma-character school which was the Chinese equivalent of the Japanese Hosso sect) under Chishu (Zhizhou in Chinese) the Bokuyo Daishi (Master Puyang), who was a dharma-grandson of Ki (Ji in Chinese, aka Kuiji) the Jion Daishi (Master Cien) and the third generation founder of the Faxiang sect in China.
sen.cmt: 原文のリンク先表示を削除しました。用語・人名を修正しました
sen.e: In 703, he visited Tang China together with Chiran and Chiyu, studied Faxiang Buddhism (or Dharma-character school which was the Chinese equivalent of the Japanese Hosso sect) under Chishu (Zhizhou in Chinese) the Bokuyo Daishi (Master Puyang), who was a dharma-grandson of Ki (Ji in Chinese, aka Kuiji) the Jion Daishi (Master Cien) and the third generation founder of the Faxiang sect in China.

sen.j: 奈良法興寺に住して法相宗を広め、日本における法相宗の第3伝とされる。
sen.e: Living at the Hoko-ji temple in Nara he propagated the Hosso sect and was the 3rd generation of the Hosso sect in Japan.
Living at the Hoko-ji Temple in Nara, Chiho propagated the Hosso sect in Japan, which was supposedly the third generation transmission of the Japanese Hosso sect.

sen.e: Living at the Hoko-ji Temple in Nara, Chiho propagated the Hosso sect in Japan, which was supposedly the third generation transmission of the Japanese Hosso sect.

sen.j: 706年（慶雲3年）藤原不比等が維摩会を復興した折にはその講師をつとめた。
sen.e: In 706 when FUJIWARA no Fuhito revived the holding `Yuimae` religious meetings Ho CHI served as a presenter.
In 706, when FUJIWARA no Fuhito revived the holding known as Yuima-e religious meetings, Chiho served as a lecturer.
